awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Order and Disorder in Spatially      Distributed Systems
awd_abstract_narration: This research is concerned with phase transitions and                      critical phenomena.  The principal investigator, in                             collaboration with D.  Abraham, recently introduced and exactly                 soluble model of three dimensional wetting; they plan to study                  some of the remaining open problems in this random surface                      model including the issue of surface roughening.  Professor                     Newman proposes to extend his joint work on percolation in half                 spaces with D. Barsky and G. Grimmett, in order to prove                        continuity of the percolation transition in full spaces.  He                    also intends to study with C. Wu related problems in inverse                    square models.  Professor Newman plans to investigate the use                   of percolation theoretic methods, which have been very fruitful                 in the study of ferromagnetic phase transitions, for the                        analysis of short range spin glasses.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
